alert.note: Alert for Adams; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 5:01PM EDT until July 18 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lewis County in northeastern Kentucky... Southeastern Adams County in southwestern Ohio... Southwestern Scioto County in southwestern Ohio... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 501 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Tollesboro to near Head of Grassy, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Vanceburg, Head of Grassy, Camp Dix, Tollesboro, Rome, Sandy Springs, Buena Vista in Scioto County, Saint Paul, Carrs, Harris, Kinniconick, Tannery, Emerson, Turkey Creek Lake, Ribolt, Charters, Garrison, Petersville, Stricklett and Glen Springs. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
